item.title: [JDK-8349729] [21u] AIX jtreg tests fail to compile with qvisibility=hidden
item.description:
jdk-21.0.7+1 on AIX is failing to compile with error:
14:56:45 ld: 0711-407 ERROR: Symbol .std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > std::__1::operator+<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> >(char const*, std::__1::basic_string<char, std::__1::char_traits<char>, std::__1::allocator<char> > const&)
14:56:45 Visibility is not allowed on a reference to an imported symbol.
14:56:45 gmake[3]: *** [test/JtregNativeJdk.gmk:148: /home/jenkins/workspace/build-scripts/jobs/jdk21u/jdk21u-aix-ppc64-temurin/workspace/build/src/build/aix-ppc64-server-release/support/test/jdk/jtreg/native/bin/NullCallerTest] Error 8

Ref build log: https://ci.adoptium.net/job/build-scripts/job/jobs/job/jdk21u/job/jdk21u-aix-ppc64-temurin/88/consoleFull

I suspect recent change: JDK-8327460
may be the cause? Not sure AIX jtreg test code links with -qvisibility=hidden
possibly??
item.summary: [21u] AIX jtreg tests fail to compile with qvisibility=hidden

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Changeset: 9c263232
Branch: master
Author: Suchismith Roy <sroy@openjdk.org>
Committer: Amit Kumar <amitkumar@openjdk.org>
Date: 2025-02-24 09:53:25 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u/commit/9c26323271a4617b800b277a6afffe7c9a566db4

Changeset: 9c263232
Branch: master
Author: Suchismith Roy <sroy@openjdk.org>
Committer: Amit Kumar <amitkumar@openjdk.org>
Date: 2025-02-24 09:53:25 +0000
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u-dev/commit/9c26323271a4617b800b277a6afffe7c9a566db4

[jdk21u-fix-request] Approval Request from suchismith1993
Solves Failing tests for xlc16.

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u-dev/pull/1425
Date: 2025-02-20 16:44:30 +0000

A pull request was submitted for review.
Branch: master
URL: https://git.openjdk.org/jdk21u/pull/459
Date: 2025-02-19 08:56:21 +0000
Hi [~aleonard] Andrew, thanks for confirming!

I can confirm I have successfully built Temurin jdk-21 using AIX xlC 17
https://ci.adoptium.net/job/build-scripts/job/jobs/job/jdk21u/job/jdk21u-aix-ppc64-temurin/91/

The Open XL 17 build uses the ($(TOOLCHAIN_TYPE), clang) part and that works.
I think XLC 16 users can change the ($(TOOLCHAIN_TYPE), xlc) part.

[~aleonard] yes this should work. We currently build 21u-dev successfully with this XLC17 :
IBM Open XL C/C++ for AIX 17.1.1 (5725-C72, 5765-J18), version 17.1.1.4, clang version 15.0.0 (build ca7115e)
Thanks Matthias, I shall try a build of Temurin jdk21u using Xlc 17

> SAP is building that config too,

We at SAP do not see the issue, but we build with XLC17 (also jdk21). The build log linked in this issue says :

15:14:58 configure: xlclang++ output: IBM XL C/C++ for AIX, V16.1.0 (5725-C72, 5765-J12)
15:14:58 configure: Using default toolchain xlc (IBM XL C/C++)
15:14:58 configure: Will use user supplied compiler CC=xlclang
15:14:58 checking for xlclang... /opt/IBM/xlC/16.1.0/bin/xlclang
15:14:58 checking resolved symbolic links for CC... /opt/IBM/xlC/16.1.0/bin/xlclang++
15:14:58 configure: Using xlc C compiler version 16.01.0000.0011 [IBM XL C/C++ for AIX, V16.1.0 (5725-C72, 5765-J12) Version: 16.01.0000.0011]

so XLC16 is used here. Not sure if some update of XLC16 would fix this; IBM might know. Maybe switching off , when working with XLC16, the changes to TestFilesCompilation.gmk done in JDK-8327460 would fix the build.

[~aleonard] SAP is building that config too, but don't see the issue. See https://bugs.openjdk.org/browse/JDK-8327460?focusedId=14751355&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-14751355
[~mbaesken] [~mdoerr] Is this something you see as well?
I also suspect the reason this is fine on jdk-25, is because that is compiled with Xlc 17.1, as opposed to Xlc 16.1 for jdk-21 maybe??
